awd_titl_txt: Dimensional Continuation Methods for the Treatment of       Electron Correlation
awd_abstract_narration: With this grant in the Theoretical and Computational Program of                 the Chemistry Division, Professor Loeser will develop a                         promising new, alternative method for predicting the electronic                 structures and associated properties of large chemical systems.                                                                                                                                                                                 The research will involve the further development and                           applications of the dimensional continuation method.  The                       applications fall into two areas.  First, recent work on the                    correlation energies of many electron atoms will be extended.                   Second, work on electron correlation in metallic hydrogen will                  be used to estimate the effects of correlation of the recently                  observed metallic transition and on structural phase                            transitions within the metal.  Some aspects of the dynamics of                  electron correlation in this prototypical solid will also be                    examined.  The longer-range goal of the research is to develop                  a general treatment of electron correlation in crystalline                      solids.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
